user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_timeout_millisec_:
```c
static int64_t
get_timeout_millisec_ (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
                       int32_t max_timeout)
{
  uint64_t d_timeout;
  mhd_assert (0 <= max_timeout || -1 == max_timeout);
  if (0 == max_timeout)
    return 0;

  if (MHD_NO == MHD_get_timeout64 (daemon, &d_timeout))
    return max_timeout;

  if ((0 < max_timeout) && ((uint64_t) max_timeout < d_timeout))
    return max_timeout;

  if (INT64_MAX <= d_timeout)
    return INT64_MAX;

  return (int64_t) d_timeout;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 == max_timeout)
    return 0;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The fragment is executed when max_timeout == 0 (the preceding assert allows 0: mhd_assert(0 <= max_timeout || -1 == max_timeout)), so the return 0 path is reachable. There is no path that makes this statement impossible to execute; it merely handles the explicit zero timeout case before calling MHD_get_timeout64.
